description: This protocol details the use of various unix commands commonly used in bioinformatics.

components.data:
group12_contigs.fasta

group20_contigs.fasta

group24_contigs.fasta

 

FASTA files - specific format

> Header line, contains ID and information about...

ATGATAGCTAGCAGCAGCTA[...] 80bp and then a newline.

uniq has a weakness, can only identify duplicates in adjacent lines

source_data.name: $ rm temp*
source_data.description: ‘*’ - acts as a wildcard, so any file that starts with temp would be identified and removed, no matter the suffix
How do temp1_ids & temp2_ids compare?

components.data: Looking at the contents of a file
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Looking at the contents of a file

source_data.name:
$ sort multiple_ids | uniq -d > temp1_ids
$ sort multiple_ids | uniq -u > temp2_ids

source_data.description: Identify duplicates:

components.data: Looking at the contents of a file

source_data.name: $ sort multiple_ids | uniq -d > temp1_ids
source_data.description: Uniq -d identifies only duplicates
Identify unique entries:

components.data: Looking at the contents of a file
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Looking at the contents of a file

source_data.name: $ sort multiple_ids | uniq -u > temp2_ids
source_data.description: Uniq -u identifies only unique entries

temp1_ids = group12_ids_with_47 &

temp2_ids = group20_ids_with_51

components.data:
seqmagick

 

Wrapper designed to utilize built in Biopython modules to manipulate and change FASTA files

 

Requires Biopython 

http://fhcrc.github.io/seqmagick/
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
seqmagick

 

Wrapper designed to utilize built in Biopython modules to manipulate and change FASTA files

 

Requires Biopython 

http://fhcrc.github.io/seqmagick/

components.data: Looking at the contents of a file
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Looking at the contents of a file

components.data:
Discuss:

  convert - produce a modified new file

  mogrify - change the input file

  info - present information of files in a directory

 

Additionally: backtrans-align, extract-ids, quality-filter, and primer-trim
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Discuss:

  convert - produce a modified new file

  mogrify - change the input file

  info - present information of files in a directory

 

Additionally: backtrans-align, extract-ids, quality-filter, and primer-trim

components.name: Expected result

components.data:
Store the information generated by ‘seqmagick info’ in a new file

fasta_info
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Store the information generated by ‘seqmagick info’ in a new file

fasta_info

components.data: Looking at the contents of a file
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Looking at the contents of a file

source_data.name:
$ cut
$ cut -f 2 fasta_info
$ cut -f 2,4 fasta_info
$ cut -f 2-4 fasta_info
source_data.description:
cut - pulling out columns from a table file
-d allows for the assignment of the type of delimiter between fields, if not TAB
-f delineates which fields to preserve, starting at 1

components.data:
history - prints a sequential list of all commands in the current session

 

echo $PATH - lists the directories for which the OS is checking for commands and data
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
history - prints a sequential list of all commands in the current session

 

echo $PATH - lists the directories for which the OS is checking for commands and data
nano - in window text editor

source_data.name: $ nano fasta_info
source_data.description:
Additional text can be entered like any text editor
To close out - Ctrl+X, hit ‘Y’, then ENTER
Create a new file - nano and then enter file name after Ctrl+X

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 79 of Unix and Bioinformatics

source_data.description: Plain text file -> executable text file.
Logging in from the terminal:

source_data.name:
$ ssh -l USERNAME SERVERNAME.WEBADDRESS.EDU
$ ssh -l btully kuat.usc.edu

source_data.description: Using top:

source_data.name: $ top
source_data.description: Produces an active table of who is using the server, the number of CPUs in use and the amount of memory/RAM being utilized

components.name: Description

Using screen:

source_data.name: $ screen
source_data.description: Creates an additional instance of the shell - that will not be disrupted if service is interrupted

components.data: Detach from a screen instance - Ctrl+A, Crtl+D
components.name: Description

source_data.name:
$ screen -ls
$ screen -r XXXX.pts-1.cdebi-VirtualBox

components.data:
Easy installs:

1.Program manager - pip, apt-get, macports

2.Executables - mothur, Trimmomatic

3.From source

 

Hard installs:

1.Improperly annotated dependencies or prerequisites
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Easy installs:

1.Program manager - pip, apt-get, macports

2.Executables - mothur, Trimmomatic

3.From source

 

Hard installs:

1.Improperly annotated dependencies or prerequisites

Change directory to /home/c-debi/Downloads
Move the compressed IDBA file to /home/c-debi/BioinfPrograms
Uncompress file:
Change directory to /idba-1.1.1
Examine the README contents

components.name: Description

source_data.description: Modify a value in the file sequence.h in directory /idba-1.1.1/src/sequence/
Change directory back to /idba-1.1.1
Complete remaining install steps:
